name: HTML AutoCloseTag
summary: Automatically closes HTML tags once you finish typing them.
description: Automatically closes HTML tag once you finish typing it with >. It is also smart enough to not autoclose tags when in a comment, when they are self-closing, or when they have already been closed. So, , upon typing >, will become |, where | is the cursor. But, if you type , the script knows to keep it the same.
install_details:
Move html_autoclosetag.vim to ~/.vim/ftplugin (or equivalent, e.g. $HOME\vimfiles\ftplugin on Windows)

To enable for xhtml/xml files, remember to add this to your .vimrc:
au FileType xhtml,xml so ~/.vim/ftplugin/html_autoclosetag.vim (or wherever you put it)

versions.release_notes: Fixed bug with closing tag when on the start of the line, and cleaned up the code a bit.
